net.viktorc.detroid.framework.tuning

Class TexelOptimizer

  • Object
    • ASGD<String,Float>
      • TexelOptimizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public final class TexelOptimizer
extends ASGD<String,Float>
implements AutoCloseable
    A class for optimizing chess engine evaluation parameters using a stochastic gradient descent algorithm with a possibly parallel cost function. The cost function is that of the Texel Tuning Method which is the average error of the evaluation scores of a set of positions exported from games with known outcomes.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Constructor Detail

      • TexelOptimizer

        public TexelOptimizer(TunableEngine[] engines,
                      int sampleSize,
                      Double baseLearningRate,
                      String fenFilePath,
                      Double k,
                      Logger logger)
               throws Exception,
                      IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs and returns a new instance according to the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        engines - An array of TunableEngine instances (of which the parameters' gray code string should have the same length). For each non-null element in the array, a new thread will be utilized for the optimization. E.g. if engines is an array of four non-null elements, the fitness function will be distributed and executed parallel on four threads. If the array or its first element are null or the method init hasn't been called on the first element, a NullPointerException is thrown.
        sampleSize - The number of positions to include in one mini-batch. The higher this number is, the slower but more stable the convergence will be.
        baseLearningRate - The base step size for the gradient descent. If it is null, it defaults to 1.
        fenFilePath - The path to the file containing the FEN list of positions to evaluate. If it doesn't exist an IOException is thrown.
        k - A scaling constant for the sigmoid function used calculate the average error.
        logger - A logger to log the status of the optimization. It cannot be null.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the engines cannot be initialised.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the logger is null, or the sample size is not greater than 0, or the data set is too small.

    • Method Detail

      • getTestData

        protected List<Map.Entry<String,Float>> getTestData()
        Description copied from class: ASGD
        Returns the test data set as a list of key-value pairs where the key is the data and the value is the ground truth label. The list should contain at least one data set. The test data should never be included in the training data samples.
        Specified by:
        getTestData in class ASGD<String,Float>
        Returns:
        An list holding the validation data mapped to the correct labels.

      • sampleTrainingData

        protected List<Map.Entry<String,Float>> sampleTrainingData()
        Description copied from class: ASGD
        Extracts a random sample from the training data set and loads it into a list of key-value pairs where the key is the data and the value is the ground truth. The list should contain at least one data set.
        Specified by:
        sampleTrainingData in class ASGD<String,Float>
        Returns:
        An list holding the training data mapped to the correct labels.

      • costFunction

        protected double costFunction(double[] features,
                              List<Map.Entry<String,Float>> dataSample)
        Description copied from class: ASGD
        Calculates the costs associated with the given feature set for the specified data sample. The better the system performs, the lower the costs should be. Ideally, the cost function is differentiable, smooth, and convex, but these are not requirements.
        Specified by:
        costFunction in class ASGD<String,Float>
        Parameters:
        features - An array of parameters.
        dataSample - A list of the training data mapped to the correct labels on which the cost function is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The cost associated with the given features.
